main event: A civilian found an unusual instrument resembling a flying saucer on private property in Jackson, Ohio, in July 1947, which was ultimately turned over to the sheriff's office.
interesting points: The object was described as a 5" x 9" x [1-/2"]" instrument, with a cardboard box component bearing U.S. Army printed material.
The instrument had a red hill-shaped cardboard device attached, along with a clear plastic box containing instruments, some of which were said to be mechanically operated.
Fragments of a rubber balloon, a small parachute, and a small wire resembling a small aerial were found at the same location as the instrument.
A man named [REDACTED] claimed to have found the instrument in a tree located on property belonging to a resident of Columbus, Ohio.
The report includes a stamped reading on the parachute: "Japanese 16-32 J. M. Apmn", indicating the origin of the parachute.
sighted object: unusual instrument resembling a flying saucer
